intro: Hieracium dollineri subsp. gadensiforme, commonly known as the Gadensiforme hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny exposures. It has a rosette of basal leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
